headline: Slow Cooker Cocktail Smokies
description: This little smokies recipe is made in the slow cooker with mini smoked sausages, barbeque sauce, and grape jelly for a crowd-pleasing party appetizer.

video.description: See how to turn three ingredients into an addictive little appetizer.
video.name: Slow Cooker Cocktail Smokies

name: Slow Cooker Cocktail Smokies
recipeIngredient: 2 (14 ounce) packages miniature smoked sausage links

recipeInstructions.text: Combine barbeque sauce and grape jelly in a slow cooker. Stir in miniature smoked sausage links. Cook on High until heated through, about 2 to 3 hours.

review.reviewBody: The most critical review is crazy lol, do not use ‚Äòsweet n sassy‚Äô with buffalo sausage.. Follow the recipe and it‚Äôs amazing!!
My kids loved this!
Wonderful as it. I have done it that way before. This time I did add a tablespoon of brown sugar. Super Yummy!
Simple & Delish!
Made this as a lunch for the kiddos paired with macaroni and cheese. Was a HUGE hit!!!
~ dunno, this was mediocre with grape jelly - the lil smokies Hormel brand were no different than hotdogs
I have used this for years except a lil less jelly and add 1/2 cup Wild Turkey 101 bourbon

This has been a traditional recipe in my family since before I was born, I would say it is a southern delicacy. I tried Kraft regular BBQ sauce and reg 8 oz concord grape jelly, we didn't have one left, easy and fast!!

This dish is requested from my family and friends for ANY get together we have. Any time someone tries them for the first time, they are absolutely amazed. I've never seen anything else that has 3 ingredients and so simple to make that turns everyone's world upside down
It was delish!!!

I've prepared this exactly as presented here many times over the years and it has always been good. The only time this was less-than-excellent was the time I allowed it to cook on HIGH for far too long. That was my one-time mistake, but I'm sharing it here just as a caution. Enjoy!
Instead of grape jelly I use Brown Sugar, sweet baby rays BBQ, and worchishire sauce. ‚ò∫Ô∏èüòã can‚Äôt ever go wrong
I use sweet baby rays original barbecue sauce with Welch‚Äôs Concord grape jelly and I always go back to this recipe it‚Äôs simple and tastes amazing!!!

I make these to this day, but not with this sauce. BBQ Sauce is overpowering for already smoked sausages. I use Red Currant Jelly, if you can find it. You can sub Apple or Grape or Blackberry). And then yellow mustard. 8 oz jar of jelly, 2 oz mustard. Dijon/Brown mustard doesn't work--use the yellow. Melt in a saucepan before pouring over the sausages. It's alot better tasting.

No changes. I used sweet baby rays bbq & welchs grape jelly as the sauce for our engagement party; simply because times r hard,&- thats what my parents had on hand. I LOVE IT,& will always remember the party,& the foodü§ó
I had to double the recipe. I think it turned out well. There were no complaints. None left over.

We used to make these for parties and potlucks in the 70's! I don't think I have bought grape jelly since then. Made these for our holiday appetizer party and what is old, is new again! Wonderful little bites! Thanks for the post.
Yummm! It was delicious CD and easy!
This is a very easy recipe to make. Great for when I need something to feed many people and not much prep is involved.
Have made this for years, great little appetizer
These are delicious, and also great made with meatballs.

We always had these(and/or cranberry meatballs!) on Christmas Eve when I was growing up and it was bittersweet to find this recipe! I made it last year and it was a hit with my family and I am looking forward to having it this year! I add some love, fond memories, and family to it and it comes out perfect!
This has been a go-to party/covered dish recipe of mine for years. It works with meat balls or sausages, and with BBQ sauce or cocktail sauce. Super easy, and never any leftovers...
This recipe is point on and can be used for meatballs and hotdogs! I changed it up just a little by giving it more of a spark by adding banana peppers. Yummy!

I've heard about this recipe quite a bit throughout the years and finally gave it a try. I made sure to use original BBQ sauce, not smoky. To me, the BBQ overpowered the grape jelly. They were good, I would just probably omit the jelly next time or use a good bit more and cut down on the BBQ sauce.
I love it! I seasoned it as well with garlic, salt, onion, pepper. It‚Äôs so yummy!
I have made this several times now. I can tell you the sauce is the most important part. I use Sweet Baby Rays and it has turned out to work the best.

I followed the recipe exactly and all I can say is Meh. I made them for a BBQ and people tried one, but did not go back for seconds. It tasted like a little smokie cooked in flavored hot dog water. I stopped off at a gas station on the way home from the BBQ and threw the leftovers in the trash.
No I didn't and yes I will.
I‚Äôve made these so many times but instead of bbq I use Heinz Chili Sauce and they are incredible

Have also used chili sauce in place of the barbeque sauce or a can of pineapple chunks and barbeque sauce or a can of consumme. This is a very forgiving recipe as you can also use meatballs in place of the little smokies.
maybe I used the wrong jelly or BBQ sauce but this just didnt turn out very good. Will try another recipe in the future.
I make it with grape jelly,chili sauce and spicey brown mustard-always a hit. Make sauce as you prefer
I made this exactly as written. They were wonderful. Everyone loved them!

I have been making this for 40 or 50 years. It was one of the "eaties" I served at my first little gathering. 

This time around, we wanted it and didn't want to go to the grocery just for a jar of grape jelly, so I substituted apple jelly for the grape jelly. Not quite as sweet as with grape, but still very good. We enjoyed it thoroughly.
I‚Äôve made these every New Year‚Äôs Eve and Super Bowl party for the past 4-5 years. I do the bbq sauce half Sweet Baby Rays Original and half Sweet Baby Rays Sweet and Spicy
Perfect! I also throw in a drained can of pineapple, very good!
Made this for a little party I was having with friends. It's super easy, and came out just fine!

I made this recipe one time as written and it turned out ok, however, the second time I made it we used apple jelly instead of grape and it definitely gave us the flavor we wanted. Have made several times now with the apple jelly.
Made with meatballs because the store was out of weenies. Very good!
So easy!!!!! Another alternate, is use cocktail sauce instead of BBQ or Ketchup. You just can‚Äôt go wrong if you mix sweet and tangy no matter what the flavor.
Allrecipes is the best! I am now the center of attention at party‚Äôs and everyone begs for my slow cooker macaroni and cheese recipe! Or should I say Allrecipes recipe!

Oh. My. GOSH! So delicious. Where has this recipe been all my life? Easy to make and can't even tell it has grape jelly in it. I followed the recipe exactly using Sweet Baby Ray's Sweet and Spicy sauce, Smuckers Concord Grape jelly, and Hillshore Farms all beef mini sausage links. I will most definitely be making these again for potlucks and get-togethers.
Classic, easy & always a hit.
So tasty and simple. Even my 6 year old ate them! I added pineapple to mine so they were a little sweet but I will be doing this again.
I use Red Currant jelly and yellow mustard.

Made these for a birthday party. I used little meatballs that I bought instead of the cocktail weiners. It was so good. Everyone loved them! I used Sweet Baby Ray's barbecue sauce. One batch was made with Sweet & Spicy barbecue sauce, the other batch was made with Honey Barbecue & regular barbecue sauce. Soooo good!
Super disappointed. The flavor was bland, the sauce was runny, and it was not sweet enough. It was really easy to make, but I wish I would have chose a different recipe.
Simple and delicious, I‚Äôd never know there was grape jelly in this recipe.
This is one of our favorites to make for our NYD feast. we use apple jelly instead of grape but that is just our preference - but achieve the same goal in the recipe.
I would wrap bacon around it.

I‚Äôm old school and have made these smokies from scratch for years but this recipe has made my permanent recipe file box. I used beef smokies with Polander grape jelly and my homemade BBQ sauce. Excellent!
Instead of BBQ sauce I used yellow mustard according to taste. Went over big time! Original was great. Maybe next time I'll do BOTH styles.
Made this for a potluck at church. Everyone loved them!

I used 2 packs of cocktail smokies, 1 big bottle of Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce, and half a jar of Welch's grape jelly. I cooked it for 2 hours on low. There were only 2 smokies left when the company pot luck was over. I call it a win!
Just made them today but I used my homemade blackberry jelly and added about half cup of red onions, 1 small jalapeno pepper and 4 minced cloves of garlic. I used mini Italian sausage. DELISH!!!!!
I'm thinking I should have used less liquid ingredients then called for - the sauce was a little runny. Or...MORE Smokies. Yes, that's it...!

Use equal parts barbecue and jelly! Also you could double the amount of meat for this amount of sauce, there‚Äôs so much sauce left over that I‚Äôm running to the store for more weinies so the sauce doesn‚Äôt go to waste.
I made per instructions using SBR BBQ sauce and welches grape jelly just doubled the recipe. They were gone super fast. Everyone loved them. Will definitely make again.

We liked this, but it was a little too sweet for my taste. I might brown the sausage next time because I prefer that texture and may cut back a little on the jelly to reduce the sweetness. Would be good with chopped onion added as well. Very easy to make, and my husband enjoyed it.

I have made little smokies with bbq sauce for years so I thought I would try then in my crock pot. They were not as good as grilling them and adding the sauce. It it took days to clean the slow cooker. Never again.

I made no changes. Couldn‚Äôt be any easier w/only 3 ingredients. I had a great appetizer for the 4 of us w/plenty left over for our company to take home w/them... which they thoroughly enjoyed the next day!!

Seems kind of plain? Not sure if there‚Äôs a certain bbq sauce and/or jelly that would make it better. Pretty good, but not sure if I would make it again this exact way. Would need to spice it up a bit.
Crowd pleaser! I am often asked to make this again. Perfect just like it is!
Everyone loved it, I too was a skeptic of the jelly.
Made it per the recipe and it came out great. We added a 3rd bag of the meat and had to scale up the sauce. Just do it - make this 3 step recipe and don't second guess or over think it.
Great appetizer that never fails. I used equal parts Smucker's grape jelly and Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce.

L O V E this recipe! This is an old timerecipe my family has been using for YEARS! Word to the wise- use a sweet bbq sauce (sweet baby rays is always a winner!) I use an entire 18oz BBQ bottle with a 12oz grape jelly. Love it!
I discovered something awesome! You cannot go wrong with jalapeno & cheddar smokeys!!!!!

I have a question because I‚Äôm seeing so many opposite reviews about what to use. Which version would be the least sweet? With the grape jelly and chili sauce or the grape jelly and bbq sauce. Concerning the bbq sauce though which kind Smokey or sweet? Or would cranberry jelly be better? Out of a can like for thanksgiving? I‚Äôm not sure but I do know I don‚Äôt want sweet I want savory but still good. Without a red sauce like ragu. Thx so much for your help.

I've been making these for years with meatballs. I use hot ketchup though and grape jelly. They are always a huge hit. Today I am making them with little hotdogs not smokies just the hotdogs which I am sure it will be fabulous. Next time maybe i'll try the BBQ sauce..

I used hickory smoked bbq sauce which is where I probably went wrong. They just didn't taste as good as the ones I've had at parties, church, etc. The sauce was watery and the flavor lackluster. Suggestions for making it better would be welcomed!

Prepare as written.
Warning: Do not use Famous Dave's BBQ sauce !
Impresses every time. Quick to put together. Tastes great. My only complaint is that there are never any leftovers :-(
These were the best version of this recipe I've had. The entire family loved them. Party hit.
I found this mixture gross. Instead I mixed original kraft BBQ sauce with brown sugar and let it cook for about 2 hours
So simple and I don't think I've had anyone not love these.
Nothing special, but always a crowd-pleaser at a gathering.
I made this for New Years. It was very good an easy to make. Just follow the recipe.. They were yummy..
Very delicious recipe. I made this for the first time this year
I tried Nor's customization and it was awesome. G'ma's Sweet Chili sauce and jellied cranberry. Wow! A big hit. Just added a garlic clove, pepper, and a couple of jalape√±o slices.

The flavor wasn't good at all. I ended up adding an equal amount of ketchup, a Tbs of dark brown sugar, a couple/three dashes of Tabasco and a pinch of cayenne. The Tabasco and cayenne really didn't give it any heat, just flavor. They were delicious after the changes
Easiest recipe to make for every single party I host or go to. Everyone loves them, and the pot is always empty by the end of party!!!!
It was far too rich for me unfortunately
So good, and addicting :) I used Sweet Baby Ray's original bbq sauce

This was a good, quick, easy way to make something the kids enjoyed. I wouldn't say it tasted just blow-your-doors off fantastic but it was a fabulous addition to our Super Bowl party. I'd make it again in a heartbeat.
It doesn't get any easier than this. Definitely a crowd pleaser for young and old. So good!

I have made these many times. I use only Hillshire Farms Beef Lil Smokes. I use 6 packages in a 6 quart crockpot and cook on low for about 4 hrs, then switch to warm if needed. I use the 8 oz. jar of grape jelly, and one bottle of Chili Sauce. Add about 1 cup of Sweet Baby Rays Sweet and Spicy BBQ sauce, and 2 Tbsp. of Jalapeno Salsa. It will cook up. Adjust the BBQ sauce if it needs a little more.
It all will make a difference, and everyone loves the way I make them.
Very good and a party favorite for years. I add a small amount of yellow mustard to cut the sweetness

This was a hit! 
I used Sweet Baby Ray's Raspberry Chipotle BBQ sauce and grape jelly. I just measured to taste. The Sweet Baby Ray's gave it a nice smokey kick. Turned out great and so easy in the crock pot!
I halved this recipe and used Sticky Fingers BBQ sauce, and used half grape jelly and half pepper jelly. It was wonderful, especially with the Belgian waffles I made for brunch.
Excellent! Quick, easy and delicious. They were a hit at our football party and everyone was surprised when I told gem grape jelly was mixed in. There were none left at the end of the day.
These are delicious, easy, & a crowd pleaser!

I know the idea of grape jelly sounds crazy, but these are so very good! And talk about easy! I'm pretty sure the only way it could get any easier is if it said to eat them straight out of the package. And the ingredient portions are really easy to adjust for larger or smaller portions. I used Kraft Original barbeque sauce and Smucker's grape jam. Perfect!

Made exactly as recipe called for and they were PERFECT! Entire family now wants these at every gathering. :) Cheap to make, SOOOOO easy, delicious to male and female/young and old, ZERO clean-up with the use of the slow-cooker liners, and inexpensive, TOO!!!!

Love this recipe, it can get expense with the little smokes if you have a crowd. I now drain a can of Dole chunked pineapples and add to this recipe. It's a crowd pleaser and I never have any left over.

These were awesome. I did notice that my barbecue sauce was a little strong, so I wound up reading the reviews and finding adding Ketchup as an extra recommended ingredient, which I used to soften it, and then they were perfect.
Turned out amazing, big hit at the super bowl party!! I used sweet baby rays original bbq sauce and of course smuckers grape jelly.
I make a similar recipe . Use equal parts grape jelly and Grey Poupon,
